snippet: The weeklong blast of Arctic air that has brought below-freezing temperatures to Southern California has severely damaged the state's citrus and avocado crops, agriculture officials said today.    "There will be major fruit damages," said Jim Smit...
lead_paragraph: The weeklong blast of Arctic air that has brought below-freezing temperatures to Southern California has severely damaged the state's citrus and avocado crops, agriculture officials said today. "There will be major fruit damages," said Jim Smith, an analyst for the United States Department of Agriculture.

headline.main: Citrus and Avocados in California Suffer Huge Losses From the Cold
